data.title: Retained lists confirmed: Every player from Premier League, Championship, League One and League Two released
data.meta_description: From Arsenal to Yeovil Town, the full list of players released by clubs
data.text:
The 2018/19 domestic season has now finished with Man City, Norwich City, Luton Town and Lincoln City all finishing the campaign as champions.

Forest Green missed out on promotion from League Two after losing to Tranmere Rovers over two legs in the play-offs and will be hoping to put a squad in place to go further next season.

Meanwhile, Cheltenham Town manager Michael Duff has his first summer to bring in his own players and build on the improvement made under him last season.

With the action over for the season, teams have revealed their retained lists for the new season.

Here are all the players who will be free agents this summer. These players could still be kept on by clubs and are subject to change.

Premier League

AFC Bournemouth: James Boote, Jordan Holmes, Marc Pugh

Arsenal: Cohen Bramall, Petr Cech, Charlie Gilmour, Stephan Lichtsteiner, Julio Pleguezuelo, Aaaron Ramsey, Danny Welbeck

Brighton & Hove Albion: Jordan Araujo, Ben Barclay, Julien Carre, William Collar, Billy Collings, Ben Hall, Stefan Ljubicic, James Moore, Owen Moore, Bruno, Joe Tomlinson, Richard Towell
